title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: In the soil which covers these fields, particles of gold have occasionally been found ; copper ore is found at Blair Logic, Airthrie, and at Fetlar, in Orkney ; antimony at Langholm ; manganese in the neighbourhood of Aberdeen ; silver has been wrought at Alva in Stirlingshire, in Clackmannanshire,  and at Leadhills in Lanarkshire ; there are extensive slate-quarries in Aberdeenshire, Argyleshire, Perthshire, and Peebles-shire ; marble is found in Argyleshire, Sutherland, and the Hebrides ; sandstone abounds generally throughout the country ; and granite and other primitive rocks within the limits of the Grampians.

title: The manuscripts of His Grace the Duke of Portland, preserved at Welbeck abbey ...
snippet: In the afternoon passed the Firth by Stirling bridge and went five miles by the bottom of the hills to Alloa in Clackmannanshire, the seat of Lord Erskine, at present the house is but indifferent, but there was a great plan begun by Lord Mar for making it a very fine place.

title: The Edinburgh gazetteer, or geographical dictionary ...
snippet: Newtonshaw, a village of Scotland, inClackmannanshire, on the river Devon,built for the accommodation of the workpeople employed by the Devon iron company.

snippet: — Mrs. Bruce was somewhat mistaken about her family dignity; as the common ancestor of all the Brnces of Stirlingshire, Clackmannanshire, and Fife, is only known to have been a relation of Daviil II., and has never been supposed to stand higher in genealogy than as a descendant of a younger brother of the father of King Robert.
